results.content: A handy reference material. Not in depth, but enough to get started quickly with OpenAPI 3.0. I would suggest taking up "Designing RESTful APIs" course from the same instructor before taking this up if you are new to API designing. More examples documenting different types of scenarios would make this course better. For example, POST and PUT examples refer to the same schema in components but in many cases, while POSTing a new resource, one does not have 'id' field already.
results.content_html: A handy reference material. Not in depth, but enough to get started quickly with OpenAPI 3.0. I would suggest taking up "Designing RESTful APIs" course from the same instructor before taking this up if you are new to API designing. More examples documenting different types of scenarios would make this course better. For example, POST and PUT examples refer to the same schema in components but in many cases, while POSTing a new resource, one does not have 'id' field already.

results.content:
Nice Course Overall..!!

But would expect one more section on the datatypes to be supported by the OpenAPI and the more types on securitySchemes. 

But by this course you can definitely get those from documentation , Since this course is specific to OpenAPI spec It should have those.!! personal opinion. thats all.  Otherwise No concerns.

response.content: Hi Pavan, based on your feedback, I've now included a new lecture that covers data types in OpenAPI including date and date-time formats. Meanwhile, thanks for leaving a rating and review.

results.content: With the need for building APIs for better integration and since it also widespread either you are producer or consumer of the APIs it is very important to understand and create API specifications efficient documentation and usage.  This course exactly does that! It helped me to understand importance of understanding and creating API specfications. And the Demo project used in the course is very helpful! Thanks to the Author for delivering in clear manner all you need as a API developer or Designer to get started with OpenAPI Specifications! I strongly recommend this course to all developers!

results.content:
Before taking up this course, I had no idea about Open API.  These days many talk about API technologies.   Am in always in thirst of search for a good training course which will run through the fundamental concepts which will be provided with use case examples.  
This is one of the best course I have ever had so far.   Tutor clearly explains using mind mapping techniques along with specifications which are mandatory, not mandatory, tips, etc which motivate the students like me to apply the knowledge immediately.
I would recommend taking up this course to get Open API specification which enables you to provide a strong foundation!

response.content: Hi Vani, mind map based explanation was the key tenet I'd planned for this course. I'm glad it helped you to understand the OpenAPI structure more easily. Thanks for your rating and review. See you more on the course!
